DataElement.preferredName: Merkel Cell Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Distant Metastasis M Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for merkel cell carcinoma based on information obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Merkel Cell Neoplasm Clinical M Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An epidermal cell, primarily located in the basal layer, that is thought to function in tactile sensory perception._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An epidermal cell, primarily located in the basal layer, that is thought to function in tactile sensory perception.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.definition: An epidermal cell, primarily located in the basal layer, that is thought to function in tactile sensory perception.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10-18-2018 Changed from Draft New to Released/tmt. 10-10-18 tmt created for standardization.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Merkel Cell Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Clinical M Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of Merkel cell carcinoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Merkel Cell Carcinoma pM1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Merkel Cell Carcinoma pM1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Merkel cell carcinoma with distant metastasis microscopically confirmed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Merkel Cell Carcinoma pM1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Merkel cell carcinoma with distant metastasis microscopically confirmed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Merkel Cell Carcinoma cM1c TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Merkel Cell Carcinoma cM1c TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Merkel cell carcinoma with metastasis to all other visceral sites. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Merkel Cell Carcinoma cM1c TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Merkel cell carcinoma with metastasis to all other visceral sites. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Merkel Cell Carcinoma cM1b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Merkel Cell Carcinoma cM1b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Merkel cell carcinoma with metastasis to lung. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Merkel Cell Carcinoma cM1b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Merkel cell carcinoma with metastasis to lung. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Merkel Cell Carcinoma cM1a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Merkel Cell Carcinoma cM1a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Merkel cell carcinoma with metastasis to distant skin, distant subcutaneous tissue, or distant lymph node(s). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Merkel Cell Carcinoma cM1a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Merkel cell carcinoma with metastasis to distant skin, distant subcutaneous tissue, or distant lymph node(s). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Merkel Cell Carcinoma cM1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Merkel Cell Carcinoma cM1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Merkel cell carcinoma with distant metastasis detected on clinical and/or radiologic examination. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Merkel Cell Carcinoma cM1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Merkel cell carcinoma with distant metastasis detected on clinical and/or radiologic examination. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Merkel Cell Carcinoma cM0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Merkel Cell Carcinoma cM0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Merkel cell carcinoma without distant metastasis detected on clinical and/or radiologic examination. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Merkel Cell Carcinoma cM0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Merkel cell carcinoma without distant metastasis detected on clinical and/or radiologic examination. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
